column4: hi all, I have a pc with windows 7 on it and it has troubles. Blue screens, freeze ups etc.. I want to figure out if this is a hardware or software problem so that's why I want to try Ubuntu. My usb startup failed and I'm reading now about the WUBI installer. I was wondering: you install it through windows, but when you run it, is it still on top of windows or more independant?
it is running itself but from a compressed filesystem on the windows partition
cool thanks I'll try it then. So it doesn't touch any windows files...
